bibl.title: B. Norman v. J.F. Warren. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Territory of Washington Spokane County

body.p: Territory of Washington, SS. County of Spokane.
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, and for the Fourth Judicial District thereof, holding terms at Spokane Falls.
In the matter of the application of B. Norman for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
To P.D. Mickel, Esq., attorney for the City of Spokane Falls.

You are hereby notified that a writ of habeas corpus has this day been issued out of this Court, directed to J.F. Warren, Chief of Police of the city of Spokane Falls, commanding him to have the body of B. Norman said to be by him imprisoned and detained under and by virtue of a commitment issued by J.F. Snyder a Justice of the Peace, upon a judgement rendered by him on the 24th day of February, 1888, in favor of said city against said B. Norman, before the Hon. George Turner, Judge of the District Court and for the Fourth Judicial District of the Territory of Washington, at the Court House in the city of Spokane Falls, said county and Territory, on Saturday the 24 25th day of February, 1888, at ten o'clock in the forenoon of said day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered of him then said B. Norman, and for him the said J.F. Warren to then and there have said writ with his return thereon.
And you are further notified that the matter of the detention of said B. Norman as aforesaid will then and there be enquired into by said Court.
Houghton Manes Jones Attorney for Petitioner.
